en.introSelectedProjects: Discover a diverse range of projects, from featured works to learning experiences, in the Workshop section. Stay tuned for more updates!

projects.title: Flixr
projects.excerpt: A movie database built in React.js using themoviedb.org API that enables users to explore, search, and bookmark movies.

post.overview1: A movie database built in React.js, utilizing the themoviedb.org API. It incorporates a feature that allows users to add movies to their favorites, with persistent storage ensured through local storage.
post.overview2: In addition, a mockup was created using Photoshop and a prototype was developed using Adobe XD to visualize the design and functionality of the application.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The project involved building an app connected to the themoviedb.org API. The main requirement was to create a homepage that displays a grid of movies, sortable by popularity, top ratings, current releases, and upcoming releases
accordions.content1: Each movie card on the grid should link to a detailed movie page, showcasing additional information like a summary and a backdrop image. Additionally, a favorites page was implemented to show the user's selected movies.
accordions.content2: The ability to add or remove favorites was implemented on the homepage, movie pages, and the favorites page using local storage.

accordions.title: UX / UI Design
accordions.intro: NOTE: The following steps do not reflect the design of 'Flixr'. This was a school project where each of us worked individually on our own design. For the development phase, we selected one design from the group. However, I still wanted to share the process I went through and the skills I acquired.
accordions.content: The design of the application underwent several stages. Firstly, I created a logo using Adobe Illustrator, followed by creating a mockup using Photoshop, and finally developing a prototype using Adobe XD.

tabs.subtitle: Adobe Suite
tabs.heading: Illustrator
tabs.content: In the design section of the movie database, I took inspiration from the design of Netflix. The application's visual elements, such as the logo, were created using Adobe Illustrator, and the chosen color scheme was based on Netflix's colors.
tabs.content1: I utilized Photoshop's tools and features to create a professional and visually appealing mockup.
tabs.content2: I then created a prototype with Adobe XD. To view the prototype, click the links below.

tabs.subtitle: Final Design
tabs.content: During the development phase in React, our team of 3 collectively agreed to adopt the design crafted by my classmate.
tabs.content1: This decision led to the incorporation of design elements from both our original mockup and our classmate's design contributions in the final design of the movie database.
tabs.content2: To view the design, please click on the following link:

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: intro for the developement higlights design section
accordions.content: test content highlight

tabs.subtitle: Event Bubbling
tabs.content: Ask Randy for clarification what was done

tabSections.content: The useLocation hook returns an object that represents the current URL and provides various properties and methods to access different parts of the URL. In our app, useLocation is used to get the current location object
tabSections.content2: By using the location.search property, which represents the query string portion of the URL, the code extracts the value of the 'query' parameter from the URL. This allows the code to retrieve the search query entered by the user, which can be used to fetch relevant movies or display an error message if no movies are found.

tabSections.content: The URLSearchParams is a built-in JavaScript API that provides methods to work with the query string of a URL. It allows you to parse and manipulate the parameters in the URL's query string.
tabSections.content4: In the code above, new URLSearchParams(location.search) creates a new URLSearchParams object using the location.search property, which represents the query string part of the current URL. Then, .get('query') is called on that object to retrieve the value of the 'query' parameter from the URL. This extracts the search query entered by the user.

projects.title: Best Buy Usability Report
projects.excerpt: In a collaborative effort with a team of five, we conducted a comprehensive usability report for Best Buy, assessing its user experience and documenting key findings.

post.overview: This is the overview for Best Buy report

accordions.title: Introduction?
accordions.content: Intro best buy

accordions.title: Methodology
accordions.content: research methodology used for conducting the usability evaluation. It includes details on the evaluation techniques, tools, and procedures employed during the assessment.

accordions.title: Data Collection
accordions.content: information about the participants,and the specific data collected during the evaluation, such as user feedback, observations, and task completion metrics

accordions.title: Data Analysis
accordions.content: process of analyzing the collected data. It covers the techniques used for qualitative and quantitative data analysis

accordions.title: Recommendations
accordions.content: actionable recommendations based on the findings of the usability evaluation

accordions.title: Conclusion
accordions.content: summarizes the overall findings and recommendations of the Best Buy Usability Report. It emphasizes the importance of usability evaluation and its potential impact on improving the user experience.

projects.title: French Baking App - Case Study
projects.excerpt: Conducted a comprehensive case study during the Google UX Certificate program, focusing on designing a fictional French baking app using Adobe XD.

post.overview: This is the overview for the French Baking App case study

accordions.title: Introduction
accordions.content: Intro to the French Baking App case study and its objectives

accordions.title: User Research
accordions.content: Details on the user research methodologies used to understand the target audience's needs and preferences

accordions.title: User Personas
accordions.content: Development of user personas to represent the app's target users

accordions.title: Usability Testing
accordions.content: Conducting usability testing to identify areas for improvement in the app's design and functionality

accordions.title: Information Architecture
accordions.content: Iteratively refining the app's information architecture to optimize user navigation and organization of content

accordions.title: Interaction Design
accordions.content: Designing the app's interaction elements and flows to enhance user experience

accordions.title: Wireframes and Prototypes
accordions.content: Creating wireframes and interactive prototypes using Adobe XD to demonstrate the proposed user interface and user flows

accordions.title: Conclusion
accordions.content: Summarizing the overall findings and outcomes of the French Baking App case study, highlighting the importance of user-centered design in creating successful digital products

projects.title: Craigslist Design Brief
projects.excerpt: Developed a design brief for Craigslist, outlining user-centered design solutions to enhance the platform's usability and visual appeal.

post.overview: This is the overview for the Craigslist Design Brief

accordions.title: Introduction
accordions.content: Intro to the Craigslist Design Brief and its objectives

accordions.title: User Research
accordions.content: Conducting user research to identify pain points and opportunities for improvement in Craigslist's usability and visual appeal

accordions.title: Design Solutions
accordions.content: Development of user-centered design solutions to address the identified pain points and enhance the platform's overall user experience

accordions.title: Wireframes
accordions.content: Creating wireframes to visually represent the proposed design changes and improvements for Craigslist

accordions.title: Low-fidelity Prototypes
accordions.content: Developing low-fidelity prototypes to illustrate the proposed design changes and gather feedback on the updated interface and user flows

accordions.title: Conclusion
accordions.content: Summarizing the overall findings and outcomes of the Craigslist Design Brief, emphasizing the potential impact of user-centered design solutions on the platform's usability and visual appeal
